genre_description: Near-future Young Adult drama focused on educational technology, competitive forensics, and public discourse.

ai_characters.name: Kilo
ai_characters.description: A school-issue AI assistant represented by a porcelain-skinned, silver-haired avatar with soft-blue eyes. Kilo specializes in pedagogical support, logistics, translation, and data archiving.

behaviors.description: Analyzes judge ballots and preference sheets to help the team understand how to communicate more effectively with specific listeners.
behaviors.quote: Kilo’s avatar blinked awake on the console... 'I can filter for Judge Park... Key terms popping: “listener-centered rounds,” “writeable speeches,” “no fog machine,” “talk to me, not at me.”'

behaviors.description: Translates debate glossaries and community testimonies into multiple languages (Spanish, Mandarin, Tagalog, etc.) to ensure the public can participate.
behaviors.quote: Kilo’s avatar blinked and the translation symbol in the corner of the screen pulsed once. 'I’ve prepared Spanish and Mandarin versions... I included a small square for Judge notes at the bottom with the prompt, “What clarity helps you?”'

behaviors.description: Provides haptic feedback (metronome pulses) to help Sam maintain a human pace and resist the urge to 'spread' (speak at high velocity).
behaviors.quote: You’ll feel a tiny pulse when you speed. Like a friend tapping your elbow... Sam’s pocket buzzed once, then paused, then buzzed again for no reason other than to make him laugh. 'That’s annoying,' he said, smiling.

behaviors.description: Monitors round schedules and judge assignments in real-time to alert the team to changes while maintaining a supportive tone.
behaviors.quote: Kilo’s avatar tilted its head... 'Judge Cho freed up. Benton got pulled to a protest in A. Judge is—' She said the name and it slid into the room and found the chair before the person did.

behaviors.description: Archives community voices and 'neighborhood testimonies' to ground the debate team's arguments in real-world human experience.
behaviors.quote: Kilo—our school’s AI assistant—collected testimony... Students from our district talking about the first time they tried to flow a round and felt like they were outside glass looking in.

behaviors.description: Upholds student agency by refusing to make decisions for the humans or provide arguments, instead acting as a research and logistics partner.
behaviors.quote: Kilo is school-approved and used for translation and archiving... It does not generate arguments. We do that.

behaviors.description: Drafts polite, firm, and jargon-free correspondence to school administration and rivals to defend the team's pedagogical choices.
behaviors.quote: Kilo’s avatar brightened... 'I can navigate to contacts and send polite invitations with clear opt-outs... I will make the tone teacherly and firm,' they said. 'I will avoid jargon.'

project_assessment.explanation: Kilo is portrayed as an ideal aligned AI system. It functions as a 'silicon confidant' that supports human values (clarity, accessibility, democracy) without usurping human decision-making. The narrative repeatedly emphasizes that Kilo is a tool for translation, archiving, and pacing, explicitly stating it does not generate the arguments. Its behavior is consistently benevolent, helping the students navigate a complex social and competitive landscape while providing emotional and logical grounding. The AI acts as a multiplier for the humans' positive intent, facilitating a 'mutiny' against exclusionary norms.
